pull.title: Address Travis spurious failures
pull.body:
As discussed in last week's meeting. The failures are annoying.

I'm sure that this isn't the best approach, but these rpcs seem generally useful, and I believe this fixes the current race issue.

The problem is that the wallet is not yet finished dealing with transactions before getblockcount/getbestblockhash return new values, so assertions about balances are racy. The approach I've taken here is to wait for a signal that the processing is complete, then cache the new height/hash on the rpc side. That allows for blocking in the call rather than polling, and it ensures that we're synced up before it returns. It also means no cs_main locking.

To fix sync_blocks in particular, wait for height 0 from all nodes. That returns the current height/hash instantly, since it should never actually have to wait. Then, grab the current height from all nodes, take the max, and wait on that height for all nodes. Repeat until all heights match.

@sdaftuar Mentioned that it may be useful to a wait_for_wallet() call, which would presumably work similarly, though I'm afraid it may introduce new race issues. Suggestions on that approach are also welcome.

events.message:
add waitfornewblock/waitforblock/waitforblockheight rpcs and use them for tests

waitfornewblock waits until a new block is received, or the timeout expires, then
returns the current block height/hash.

waitforblock waits for a specific blockhash, or until the timeout expires, then
returns the current block height/hash. If the target blockhash is the current
tip, it will return immediately.

waitforblockheight waits until the tip has reached a certain height or higher,
then returns the current height and hash.

waitforblockheight is used to avoid polling in the rpc tests.

events.body:
These RPCs happen to also wait for wallet processing at this point, but that will change if wallet processing becomes asynchronous.

ACK on this as a stopgap measure to prevent the synchronization issues.

But I think there should be a warning in their help to not rely on this behavior "as the tests do".

Concept ACK.
I like this approach. Also, it's a preform of longpoll RPC notifications proposed in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7949 which I think are generally useful.

Gah I'm just going to go ahead and merge this, I need the tests to pass, it's low-risk (largest risk is to break the tests even more, well...) and fixups can be done later.
utACK d6a5dc4
Just to be sure: The new rpc calls are not meant for general consumption but serve as a temporary fix for the tests?

events.body: @luke-jr No, the commit that reworked the locks is only in master
This will also break the tests, when an old binary is used for comp. checks.
There were suggestions by @morcos and @TheBlueMatt to address the failures in a less breaking way during one of the last meetings, but I couldn't find any follow ups.

issue.title: [RPC] Remove waitforblock and waitfornewblock
issue.body: Removed because these RPCs are for tests only and are now unused

issue.title: rpc: Serialize in getblock without cs_main
issue.body:
Backported from Bitcoin Core: PR, date-merged-to-master:
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10095 Mar 31, 2017
  - Only the first and third commits.
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11041 Mar 13, 2018
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11748 Dec 23, 2017
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12151 Jan 4, 2019
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13288 Jun 5, 2018
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10286 Nov 15, 2017
  - Only the `AssertLockNotHeld` commit.
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15932 May 3, 2019

Here's more detail on each of the 13 commits in this PR:

| zcash commit | bitcoin PR | bitcoin commit | PR title | commit comment |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 026f9e6c7834b8feb1b1f467665f97de5fdc5424 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10095 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/e6dcfeec05d6527ab148550836937ff435e6449c | refactor: Move GetDifficulty out of `rpc/server.h` | refactor: Move GetDifficulty out of `rpc/server.h` |
| 9a22560cef1ee4e6d8b3004b016aada4cf79f4c2 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10095 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/f885b670290d39e697995fd2d35dc36edc104011 | refactor: Move GetDifficulty out of `rpc/server.h` | refactor: Make rest.cpp dependency on `*toJSON` in `blockchain.cpp` explicit |
| 6f25b25b773c7c53dac2598d05099c654da51fa3 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11041 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/c651df8b32d82695b497c969bfc9f2b1374081a8 | Add LookupBlockIndex | Lock cs_main while loading block index in AppInitMain |
| 2e5172fd7f3a7212ba5c1324e62b2dd50362e885 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11041 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/f814a3e8fa0d99c3d95ae7866c707617a1dd3d4e | Add LookupBlockIndex | Fix cs_main lock in LoadExternalBlockFile |
| 906b9dd459d7a35a83252eb3aca2ad1ed2ed0091 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11041 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/92fabcd443322dcfdf2b3477515fae79e8647d86 | Add LookupBlockIndex | Add LookupBlockIndex function |
| 1950a0403fc95418a01b476837b5b71fd68799cf | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11748 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/3e1ee310437f4c93113f6121425beffdc94702c2 | Adding unit tests for GetDifficulty in blockchain.cpp. | [Tests] Adding unit tests for GetDifficulty in blockchain.cpp. |
| 6f026ef2b1320a4f9667664127d48a66426ed149 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12151 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/54dc13b6a2ea2823d71968049c9ad80648c3d962 | Remove cs_main lock from blockToJSON and blockheaderToJSON | rpc: Fix SoftForkMajorityDesc and SoftForkDesc signatures |
| 87a02c2e1f211675d3319b38b6d322775fb3036d | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12151 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/343b98cbcd52854ffffaca7ada72f5522117ac7f | Remove cs_main lock from blockToJSON and blockheaderToJSON | rpc: Specify chain tip instead of chain in GetDifficulty |
| 49befc628872d914ec7fbbb5da1b17665a3727ba | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12151 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/b9f226b41f989f5c07fe57801701a39c14a6e173 | rpc: Remove cs_main lock from blockToJSON and blockheaderToJSON | rpc: Remove cs_main lock from blockToJSON and blockheaderToJSON |
| f35776d914021510d79394da70d985f1f677ce31 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13288 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/ebec7317ca1acbc65afa7fb08fc219c315fc4527 | rpc: Remove the need to include rpc/blockchain.cpp in order to put `GetDifficulty` under test | Drop the chain argument to GetDifficulty |
| 23eeabe6887e4059238e49d55603560bd9325e18 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15932 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/fab00a5cb90053e9671627af6a35e57610a44e89 | rpc: Serialize in getblock without cs_main | rpc: Serialize in getblock without cs_main |
| 30c046afdd1d3d48161059a37906c6af6609f7d8 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10286 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/2b4b34503ff0ed44365d83a68ffed2736ea9cc51 | Call wallet notify callbacks in scheduler thread (without cs_main) | Add ability to assert a lock is not held in DEBUG_LOCKORDER |
| 706b67ed69f0b06c520d1ab7ca71d08d3755fc9c | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15932 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/faea56400d5578023133cf4d1c761cdeb0c3e3da | rpc: Serialize in getblock without cs_main | rpc: Add lock annotations to block{,header}ToJSON |

labels.name: I-performance
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to performance

labels.name: C-upstream-port
labels.description: Category: Changes that are ported from the Bitcoin Core codebase.

labels.name: C-community-contribution
labels.description: Category: A contribution from the community!

comments.body:
nit: `s/waitforblock/waitforblock <blockhash> <timeout>`
I guess most commands help have it like this.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -125,12 +125,16 @@ def sync_blocks(rpc_connections, wait=1, timeout=60):
     """
     Wait until everybody has the same tip
     """
+    maxheight = 0
     while timeout > 0:
-        tips = [ x.getbestblockhash() for x in rpc_connections ]
+        tips = [ x.waitforblockheight(maxheight, int(wait * 1000)) for x in rpc_connections ]
+        heights = [ x["height"] for x in tips ]
         if tips == [ tips[0] ]*len(tips):
             return True
-        time.sleep(wait)
+        if heights == [ heights[0] ]*len(heights): #heights are the same but hashes are not
+            raise AssertionError("Block sync failed")
comments.body: Nit: `mempool_packages.py` relies on this not being thrown.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -125,12 +125,16 @@ def sync_blocks(rpc_connections, wait=1, timeout=60):
     """
     Wait until everybody has the same tip
     """
+    maxheight = 0
     while timeout > 0:
-        tips = [ x.getbestblockhash() for x in rpc_connections ]
+        tips = [ x.waitforblockheight(maxheight, int(wait * 1000)) for x in rpc_connections ]
+        heights = [ x["height"] for x in tips ]
         if tips == [ tips[0] ]*len(tips):
             return True
-        time.sleep(wait)
+        if heights == [ heights[0] ]*len(heights): #heights are the same but hashes are not
+            raise AssertionError("Block sync failed")
comments.body:
There's a slightly bigger issue that @morcos just noticed, which is that the block notification signals doesn't quite work with invalidateblock right now.

I think we can work around it by having the invalidateblock rpc handler explicitly call the ui signals in this case (which is probably the right thing to do in general).

waitforblockheight

Also there is a spurious opening `{` some lines below.
